intro: Actinella scaposa var. mutica, commonly known as the scaly actinella, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are distinctive, featuring a hairy or scaly texture, which gives it its common name. The flowers are small and white, often clustered in umbrella-like clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in native gardens.
